{"step_by_step_thinking": "Clubfoot, or talipes equinovarus, is a congenital deformity that is present at birth. It can be caused by a variety of factors. CTEV, or Congenital Talipes Equinovarus, is another name for clubfoot, so it is definitely a cause. Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita is a condition that causes many joints to be stiff and deformed at birth, which can include clubfoot. Spina bifida is a neural tube defect that can cause a variety of physical deformities, including clubfoot. Polio, on the other hand, is a viral infection that can cause paralysis and muscle weakness, but it is not a cause of clubfoot in newborns because it is not a congenital condition.", "answer_choice": "C. Polio"}
